event: Earliest human settlement in present-day Norway after Ice Age retreat
Neolithic communities establish coastal fishing and farming settlements
Nordic Bronze Age culture develops with maritime trade networks
Iron Age societies form regional chieftaincies
Viking Age begins with seaborne raids and exploration
Traditional unification of Norway under Harald Fairhair
Christianity spreads, reshaping Norwegian society and kingship
Norwegian Viking expansion era ends after North Sea conflicts
Norwegian medieval kingdom reaches territorial height
Black Death devastates population and weakens the kingdom
Norway enters the Kalmar Union with Denmark and Sweden
Norway becomes a subordinate kingdom under Danish rule
Union with Denmark ends; Norway enters union with Sweden
Norway gains full independence and establishes constitutional monarchy
Nazi Germany occupies Norway during World War II
Norway is liberated and restores democratic rule
North Sea oil discoveries transform the economy
Norway chooses to remain outside the European Communities
